page.title: 13EDINGWORTH
page.content: IN THE CENTRE OF THIS BLOCK,NOW SPLIT INTO TWO SECTIONS BY THE M5,EDINGWORTH IS A SMALL SOMERSET FARMING COMMUNITY.IT IS ISOLATED IN THAT IT IS ON A SMALL BY ROAD,VISITED ONLY BY THE INQUISITIVE,YET WITHIN A KILOMETER OF THE BUSY A370. THE COMMUNITY IS BASED UP ON THREE DAIRY FARMS.THESE,WITH BUILDINGS DATING FROM THE NINETEENTH CENTURY FORM A CLOSE COMMUNITY.WITH MODERN FARMING METHODS,MANY LOCAL PEOPLE HAVE TO TRAVEL TO GAIN EMPLOYMENT. THE LAND,SITUATED BETWEEN BRENT KNOLL AND THE MENDIPS IS MAINLY USED FOR DAIRY CATTLE,BUT SOME CROPS ARE NOW BEING GROWN AS DRAINAGE IS IMPROVED.
